name: Janie Langdale
text: Great to work with, they have years of engineering and surveying experience that shows. I would definitely use them again.

name: Mary Williamson
text: Excellent group of professionals with a wide range of skills. Highly recommend!

name: KR Manier
text: They surveyed my property, their crew was very friendly and professional, and completed the job quickly.

name: Brian Kirk
text: Wonderful to work with!  Thanks for all you do.

name: Tim Arrington
text: Excellent company, very responsive and does a great job with all my Surveying and Engineering needs..

resp.text: Thanks Tim we appreciate your business

name: Aaron Williamson
text: They've done multiple surveys for me.  Service was excellent.  Will use again.

resp.text: Thank you Aaron. We appreciate your buisness

name: D Nunn (Big O)
text: Very UNresponsive, I contacted this establishment to get a survey done on my property...after several emails and phone calls...haven been promised a price quote some 5 weeks ago, I have yet to get a call from the representative (I will withhold her name).

name: Ben Landers
text: I would highly recommend not using Pugh Wright McNally for a new construction survey. The initial survey cost was triple the price of any of their competitors. They charged an additional $350 for a plot plan and to stake the house out. None of the additional costs were disclosed up front. We were under the impression that the initial $950 would cover all aspects related to pre construction survey. We were told today that it costs $1300.

resp.text:
BL. Sorry you are unhappy with the cost to do this work.  Our records indicate you were quoted an estimate of $900 for a boundary survey and proposed plot plan. An additional $200 for a Certificate to subdivide.  Fees are paid by property owners for recording.  No quote was provided to stake the house.  These are three separate items and significantly more than just a “pre-construction survey” The work was way more involved than expected and as you are aware we discounted the invoice over $670 not charge more than the quoted amount plus recording fees.

Getting the work done properly and accurately is more important than recovering our expenses. PWM never strives to be the least expensive and we never tell a client that we are.  What we do is provide a quality product that we will stand behind at a fair market value.

Blake McAnally
Thanks Barry!  Happy to have had the opportunity to work with you.
